definitions.definition: Agreement or concurrence of opinion, will, or action.
A harmony in sound, pitch and tone; concord.
Agreement or harmony of things in general.
definitions.example: the accord of light and shade in painting

definitions.definition: An agreement between parties in controversy, by which satisfaction for an injury is stipulated, and which, when executed, prevents a lawsuit.

definitions.example: The Geneva Accord of 1954 ended the French-Indochinese War.

definitions.definition: Voluntary or spontaneous impulse to act.
definitions.example: Nobody told me to do it. I did it of my own accord.

definitions.definition: To make to agree or correspond; to suit one thing to another; to adjust.
To bring (people) to an agreement; to reconcile, settle, adjust or harmonize.
To agree or correspond; to be in harmony; to be concordant.
To agree in pitch and tone.
To grant as suitable or proper; to concede or award.
